New Records: Tyler Herro set a franchise record with his 70th consecutive game with at least one made three-pointer, breaking Duncan Robinson's record of 69 games set in 2021.
Key Match Events: Tyler Herro led the Miami Heat with 23 points.
Jaime Jaquez Jr. scored 20 points, including five crucial points in the final 1:03.
The Heat outscored the Jazz 17-7 in fast-break points.
Collin Sexton and Lauri Markkanen each scored 23 points for the Jazz.
The Jazz successfully challenged a foul call on Walker Kessler but lost the ensuing jump ball.
Jaime Jaquez Jr. made a pivotal three-pointer in the final minutes, giving Miami a five-point cushion.
Pre-Game Insights: The Heat were coming off a blowout loss to Utah in the first game of Jimmy Butler’s seven-game suspension.
Kevin Love missed the game for personal reasons, but his emotional leadership has reportedly galvanized the team during Butler’s absence.
Post-Match Reflections: The Heat have steadily improved, narrowly losing in double overtime to Sacramento before notching back-to-back wins against Golden State and Utah.
The Jazz extended their home losing streak to nine games.
The Heat (19-17) continue their road trip with a game against the Portland Trail Blazers on Saturday.
The Jazz (9-27) will face the Phoenix Suns in an afternoon matchup that same day.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Jazz remain the league’s worst team at protecting the ball, committing 17 turnovers on the night.
